Description: Handle and upper body sherd (mended from four fragments, including 1888,0601.644h) of East Greek, possibly Aeolian, grey ware large pottery vessel, possibly an krater; horizontal, oval, handle; interior: reserved; exterior: grey slip; decoration in relief of tendrila emerging from ends of handle and terminating in a dot.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.644.h and 1924,1201.70. The fabric finds parallels with British Museum 1888,0601.644.c. This sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn). The origin of the fabric (NAUK 47) was not identified and considered a chemical singleton.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.120)
